text: More than 400 public health and criminal justice experts penned a letter to the CDC urging its immunization advisory committee to vaccinate incarcerated people alongside those in long-term care facilities. https://t.co/yHOPaEvThb @WHYYNews

name: NPR
text: The irony of Nipsey Hussle's untimely death sheds light on the larger backdrop of inequality in his hood: mass supervision in Black communities. @LouderThanARiot reports on Nipsey Hussle, the LAPD And the inescapable trap of gang affiliation. https://t.co/0EjjEJ7AKD

name: NPR
text: The oldest ice on Earth probably is hiding somewhere in Antarctica, because this frozen continent holds ice that's hundreds of thousands and even millions of years old. Scientists are hoping to find it. https://t.co/1SclV8qDtd

name: NPR
text: U.S. tourists aren't welcome in most countries around the world because of the high number of coronavirus cases surging in the United States. But at least one country is keeping its borders open: Mexico. https://t.co/QCyHfeDjfR

name: NPR
text:
Amid the coronavirus pandemic, people around the world are celebrating a Christmas unlike any other.
